poem:
Glastonbury Reverie

On the Pyramid stage,  
legends and echoes  
Rod, Olivia, Nile—  
notes weaving a tapestry  
of time and rhythm.   
The sun dips—  
beyond the horizon,  
as melodies cradle  
the earth and air,  
while the crowd sways  
within a fleeting moment  
that lingers eternal  
in the heart's memory.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Glastonbury 2025: Sunday with Rod Stewart, Olivia Rodrigo, Chic and more – follow it live 12.54pm BST Looking ahead to the rest of the day, we’ve got a stacked lineup on the Pyramid stage – with the Libertines at 2pm, followed by Rod Stewart in the legends slot, then fellow legends Nile Rodgers & Chic. Noah Kahan will be taking us through to the evening, then there’s the final headliner, Olivia Rodrigo. She played the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
